summary: This bill, the "Repealing Illegal Freedom and Liberty Excises Act" or "RIFLE Act," aims to repeal the firearm transfer tax outlined in Section 5811 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It includes conforming amendments to other sections of the code to reflect the repeal and specifies that the changes apply to transfers after the bill's enactment. It also clarifies that the bill doesn't place firearms under the jurisdiction of the United States Consumer Product Safety Commission.
